chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy Alan Farvour was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.
  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Court orders bond on file to be applied. Restitution is paid in full.

Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. The defendant is to have NO CONTACT with any females under the age of 18 years unless in the direct supervision of a parent.  The defendant is to have NO CONTACT with C. or R. Hohenstein.  Defendant is not to possess any pseudoephederine and/or ephederine.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt: From DOC requesting correction of JOC.
Transcript of Plea & Sentencing Hearing - January 26, 2016

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: 1:37 pm cases called- 15CF78, 15CF148 & 15CM143. Defendant Timothy Alan Farvour in court with attorney John B. Selsing.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and read into record by DA Blader. Preliminary hearing on 15CF148-Court addresses preliminary hearing-defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of right to preliminary hearing. Court has read the complaint, finds probable cause and enters an order binding the defendant over for trial.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea:  15CF148-No Contest to Count 1. No Contest to Count 2. No Contest to Count 7. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in Counts 3, 4, 5, 6, & 8 of 15CF148, 15CF78 & 15CM143. Statement by victim in 15CM143. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Selsing. Statement by the defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: COUNT 1-5 years Wisconsin State Prison to be served as 2 years Initial Confinement & 3 Years Extended Supervision. Credit for 98 days served. COUNT 2- 3 1/2 years Wisconsin State Prison to be served as 18 month Intial Confinement and 24 months Extended Supervision. Concurrent to Count 1. COUNT 7- SWD and places the defendant on probation for a period of 1 year, Consecutive to Count 1 & Count 2. CONDITIONS OF ES & Probation: AODA and follow through,   Maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No Contact with any females under the age of 18 years of age unless in the immediate company of a parent. No Contact with C. or R. Hohenstein. Defendant not to possess any pseudoephederine and/or ephederine. Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Court directs costs to be paid from up to 25% of inmate earnings. Restitution in the amount of $50.00 to be paid. Bond to be applied.  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Court finds defendant eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program. Appeal Rights Given.

11:54 am case called. Defendant Timothy Alan Farvour in court with attorney John B. Selsing.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by DA Blader. Attorney Selsing makes a statement to court regarding adjournment. Court makes statement regarding request of Attorney Selsing and respectfully declines to modify bond. Statement by DA regarding offer if defendant were to post bond. Court admonishes defendant.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 10:33 AM: Defendant Timothy Alan Farvour in court with attorney John B. Selsing.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed.  Defendant wishes to waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of 10 day time limits for preliminary hearing.   DA has extended written offer and Atty Selsing confirms informal PTC will take place.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Atty Selsing argues for bond modification - Green Lake matters have been resolved and bond was reduced in Green Lake Co.  Requests the Court consider a Signature Bond or significantly reduced cash bond.  DA states opposition to any bond modification at this time - requests cash bond remain as ordered.  The Court:  Respectfully declines to modify cash bond - record of multiple BJump incidents.  Status conference scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Defendant is not to be in possession of any product having a chemical component of either ephederine or psuedoephederine.

10:30 am case called. Defendant Timothy Alan Farvour in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint stated. Defendant has confirmed receipt. Court questions defendant regaridng counsel-wishes to have counsel represent him. Court directs defendant to apply to SPD for appointment of counsel. Bond argument by DA Blader. Statement by defendant. Court finds Riverside Ruling.  Initial appearance scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 10:30 am. court removes Jury Trial set for December 3 due to new charges.
Petition and Order for Writ of Habeas Corpus ad Prosequendum
